intro: Neoporteria intermedia var. calderana, commonly known as the California mountain mallow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
